This course satisfies the new Religion major requirement:- Region, Theme.
This course will examine philosophical writings vis-Ã -vis topics such as: African theology, religious divination, metaphysics, human agency, the self, communalism and African society. 
What is African Philosophy? 
How have African Philosophy permeated and shaped African culture and beyond? 
Is African Philosophy diverse?
We will study the philosophical origins of African culture. 
We will focus on decolonizing African thought. 
We will read philosophical writings examining African theology, religious divination, metaphysics, human agency, the self, and communalism.
Writings from John Mbiti, Okot p'Bitek, Desmond Tutu, Kwasi Wiredu, Wole Soyinka, Paulin Hountundji, and others will help us to produce a critical approach to African post-colonial thought and its scholarship.
